Breadth-First.Explanation: Enumerates a wide range of clues (signs, paths, styles) without narrowing to a new hypothesis, broad clue collection.

Depth-First.Explanation: Zeroes in on a single man-made feature (blue street sign) to verify country context.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Blue street sign design suggesting Germany

Depth-First.Explanation: Focuses on specific font (DIN 1451) and partial name on the street sign to refine the location.
Uses a clear hypothesis (Munich) and plans targeted verification via Street View.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Munich location – compare bike path, building style, street sign

Depth-First.Explanation: Narrowly examines sign text, traffic signs, paths, and architecture to refine to Laim district.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Laim district based on 'Hasenecklstraße' and local features

Depth-First.Explanation: Confirms the exact intersection (Fürstenrieder Straße & Hasenecklstraße) via Street View.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Intersection match in Google Street View

Depth-First.Explanation: Synthesizes and re-confirms the specific intersection hypothesis.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Final confirmation of Fürstenrieder Straße & Hasenecklstraße

Depth-First.Explanation: Summarizes all verified clues into the confirmed intersection result.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Cross-referenced evidence pointing to Fürstenrieder Straße, Laim

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shifted from focused sign analysis to broad gathering of all possible clues.
Moved from wide clue collection to targeted hypothesis verification (Munich via Street View).
